newsitem.title: USA: Oregon Senate defeats transportation tax bill.
newsitem.headline: Oregon Senate defeats transportation tax bill.

text.p: Oregon's Republican-controlled Senate on Saturday rejected a controversial transportation tax bill less than a week after it was narrowly approved by the House.

The House plan would have raised $1.6 billion, partly from a three-cent-a-year increase in gas taxes over the next three years. That plan also called for a $1.20 surcharge on telephone bills to fund alternative transportation for the disabled and elderly. Vehicle registration fees were also to increase.
The Senate Transportation Committee reduced the gas tax and registration fee increases, and eliminated the surcharge.
The full Senate began debating the amended tax bill Friday afternoon. It was defeated early Saturday after two floor votes, state officials said.
